text:
On 12/19/2024 at 02:50 PM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/19/2024 at 03:24 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Math
Just connected with Alan. He had no idea what you scheduled for Adrian today. Fortunately for AD, another child unfortunately was ill. How
should I work with you on issues related to him moving forward? Does he know he is coming over here like we discussed with Kari?
I think that you own the calendar. If that was incorrect, my bad. I desperately want to work with you (across all the things you are unilaterally
deciding) and keep asking how, but it feels like I can’t crack the nut. Open to any advice that shows mutual respect and understanding.
Were you able to speak with your therapist so we could get the green light to work on tools for you and I, like we discussed at hoops? I really
can’t think of anything that will pay bigger dividends than you and I working together to be better parents. Starting the new year right.
On 12/19/2024 at 01:42 PM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/19/2024 at 01:56 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Math
Is the partial answer intentional?
You didn’t really answer the question. Especially, if you envision a place for me in his life for academic discussions. I did get him into SAAS so
maybe that’s all you wanted after he got rejected. So let me know.
I hate being shut out my kids lives, but that’s your call.
On 12/19/2024 at 01:18 PM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/19/2024 at 01:36 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Math
Ok. Confirming Adrian pick up at 3:45 at bus stop today by Alan.
Math - Adrian and I are reviewing the materials sent by the school over break and I will provide feedback once school starts.
On 12/19/2024 at 01:13 PM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/19/2024 at 01:14 PM)
Subject:Re: Adrian’s Math
Thanks. I have a very long list of things I have not seen a response on. How do we address that since this is a one way street and you refuse to
accommodate the way we addressed every issue you had at this exact time last week? Instead, you got all your answers and then said “I’m not
doing that.”
Adrian is never picked up at school. I pay $125 an hour. I’d prefer to pay that for the time I spend with him.
And given the pressing topic, and one that you refuse to reply to for some reason- can you speak to the math situation and get back to me on
that! I see him in less than two hours. It is always this way with you.
